name: $getLibPath
desc: this is a stub and MUST be overloaded in a library's startup task to return that library's path

name: $sqlBETWEEN
desc: This method is used to create a BETWEEN statement for PostgreSQL

name: $sqlLIKE
desc: This method creates a LIKE statement for PostgreSQL

pvardefs.name: pField
pvardefs.desc: Field to use for the statement

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Value the field needs to be like

pvardefs.name: pWildCardType
pvardefs.desc: Wildcard position for this LIKE. 0 = Before only, 1 = After only, 2 = Before and After.

pvardefs.name: pNot
pvardefs.desc: kTrue = Not LIKE, kFalse = LIKE

name: $sqlIN
desc: This method creates an IN statement for PostgreSQL.  It is assumed that you have already taken care of the quotes if it is a character field, or no-quotes if it is numeric.

pvardefs.name: pField
pvardefs.desc: Field to look for the values

pvardefs.name: pValues
pvardefs.desc: Values to place in the IN Statement

pvardefs.name: pNotIn
pvardefs.desc: True if this is a NOT IN Statement

pvardefs.name: pTable
pvardefs.desc: Name of the table we are inserting to

pvardefs.name: pInsertCols
pvardefs.desc: Column names to insert to

pvardefs.name: pValuesSection
pvardefs.desc: Values or SELECT for the VALUES() section

pvardefs.name: pSubSelect
pvardefs.desc: This is uses a sub-select.

pvardefs.name: pFieldName
pvardefs.desc: Name of the field in the query we wish to get the length of

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Character: Field representing kTrue or kFalse - Passed as character for higher compatibility

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: date field to convert to SQL search.  Avoid using iServerTimeOffset unless logged in to ensure we get a good server time.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: date/time field to convert to SQL search contruct.   Avoid using iServerTimeOffset unless logged in to ensure we get a good server time.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Time field to search by.   Avoid using iServerTimeOffset unless logged in to ensure we get a good server time.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: number to format for adding/subtracting in an SQL statement

pvardefs.name: pString
pvardefs.desc: The full set of values to be searched

pvardefs.name: pSubstring
pvardefs.desc: String of values to be located within the pString

lvardefs.name: stringQuote
lvardefs.desc: single quote around non database fields

lvardefs.name: subStringQuote
lvardefs.desc: single quote around non database fields

pvardefs.name: pbPool
pvardefs.desc: kTrue = we have a session pool else we should have pStatement

lvardefs.name: lbSetManually
lvardefs.desc: set the defaults with the hard coded values

pvardefs.name: pcCode
pvardefs.desc: technique of attack

pvardefs.name: pcSubCode
pvardefs.desc: parameter in which attack first detected

pvardefs.name: pcMessage
pvardefs.desc: any sort of explanation, may be empty

pvardefs.name: prParams
pvardefs.desc: row of parameters passed from ultra thin call, or service call

pvardefs.name: pcServiceType
pvardefs.desc: ultra thin, webService or other external call from .  It will empty when called from Omnis because everything to refer to will be in pParams

pvardefs.name: pcEnvironment
pvardefs.desc: something like Python, PHP etc

pvardefs.name: pcColumns
pvardefs.desc: must contain a comma separated list of valid column names, each enclosed in single quotes, ie.  'C1','C2','C3'

name: $addColumnToListOrRow
desc: adds a column to the passed list or row if it does not already exist

name: $columnExists
desc: checkes the list or row variable, pListOrRow, for the existence of pcColName and returns True/False

pvardefs.name: pbFetchFromDB
pvardefs.desc: should always get from postgres if possible

name: $getTableLibrary
desc: return the library that pcTable is in

pvardefs.name: pnDelimiter
pvardefs.desc: 0 = no delimiter   1 = new line     2 = start method     3 = end method
